intro: Coccoloba novogranatensis, commonly known as the Trinidadian glorybower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Trinidad and Tobago, as well as parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are usually deeply lobed and have a distinctive, almost fern-like appearance. It produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Coccoloba novogranatensis is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates.
